items.synopsis: Polls are beginning to close across the country and counting is underwayÂ in the Voice to Parliament referendum. Follow our live blog for the latest updates.

title.children: Polls begin closing and counting starts after nation votes on Voice proposal

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: You'll hear the word "projected" a lot tonight. Here's Insiders host David Speers and the ABC's chief election analyst Antony Green with a breakdown of what that means exactly.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It's not a race, but electoral officials in Ballimore and Glenthompson are the first to finish counting votes tonight. In both polling places, in the seats of Parkes and Wannon respectively, No got more than 75 per cent of the vote. But they're very early figures, don't expect them to be representative of the final result. We're expecting the figures will quickly turn from a trickle to a flood.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: The first votes have been reported

children.content: It's not a race, but electoral officials in Ballimore and Glenthompson are the first to finish counting votes tonight.
In both polling places, in the seats of Parkes and Wannon respectively, No got more than 75 per cent of the vote.
But they're very early figures, don't expect them to be representative of the final result.
We're expecting the figures will quickly turn from a trickle to a flood.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Remember, voting ends at 6pm wherever you are. That means polls have now closed in NSW, Victoria, Tasmania and the ACT. Here's your form guide on what to expect as the count begins tonight. And here's your explainer on what a double majority is and how it works.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Polls have closed in NSW, Victoria, Tasmania and the ACT

featuredLink.title: A double majority is needed for the Voice referendum to pass. What does that mean and how does it work?

items.synopsis: A week after Hamas terrorists' brutal attack on Israel, up to 150 kidnap victims remain in Gaza. Experts on hostage negotiation and terrorism say the world now faces several difficult choices.

title.children: The world's never seen a hostage crisis quite like this. Here's how it could play out

image.altText: Family in a car with mattresses and children on the roof drive street in Gaza

items.synopsis: Residents of Gaza City will be given an additional six hours to evacuate, the Israeli Army Arabic language spokesman Avichay Adraee has said. Follow live.Â

title.children: Civilians given additional six hours to evacuate Gaza, Israeli army spokesman says

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Israeli Army arabic language spokesman Avichay Adraee has posted on X, formerly Twitter, that residents of Gaza City will be allowed to leave on two roads between 10am and 4pm local time. It's currently just before 9am in Gaza. The post on X, which includes a map, translated from Arabic into English reads: An important statement to the residents of Gaza City  In recent days, we have appealed to you to leave Gaza City to the south of Wadi Gaza in order to preserve your safety. I would like to inform you that the IDF will allow movement on the indicated streets without any harm between the hours of 10:00-16:00. For your safety, take advantage of the short time to move south â from Beit Hanoun to Khan Yunis. If you care about yourself and your loved ones, go south as instructed. Rest assured that Hamas leaders have taken care of themselves and are taking cover from strikes in the region. Residents of the beach, sand, and west of Olive will also be allowed to move on Daldul and Al-Sana Streets towards Salah Al-Din and Al-Bahr Streets.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israeli Army will allow safe movement out of Gaza City for six hours

children.content: The Israeli Army arabic language spokesman Avichay Adraee has posted on X, formerly Twitter, that residents of Gaza City will be allowed to leave on two roads between 10am and 4pm local time.
It's currently just before 9am in Gaza.
The post on X, which includes a map, translated from Arabic into English reads:

An important statement to the residents of Gaza City  In recent days, we have appealed to you to leave Gaza City to the south of Wadi Gaza in order to preserve your safety. I would like to inform you that the IDF will allow movement on the indicated streets without any harm between the hours of 10:00-16:00. For your safety, take advantage of the short time to move south â from Beit Hanoun to Khan Yunis. If you care about yourself and your loved ones, go south as instructed. Rest assured that Hamas leaders have taken care of themselves and are taking cover from strikes in the region. Residents of the beach, sand, and west of Olive will also be allowed to move on Daldul and Al-Sana Streets towards Salah Al-Din and Al-Bahr Streets.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Israel Defense Force spokesperson Jonathan Conricus said in the live stream there were Israeli Reserve soldiers around the Gaza Strip awaiting information for the next stage of the operation. Mr Conricus has reaffirmed the IDF's objective was to target Hamas. "The end state of this war is that we will dismantle Hamas and their military capabilities and fundamentally change the situation so that Hamas never again has the ability to inflict any damage on Israeli civilians or soldiers," he said. He said in the broadcast that "Palestinian civilians in Gaza are not our enemies." "If they were, the situation in Gaza would be entirely different," he said. "We are trying to do the right thing, we are trying to evacuate civilians in order to minimise the risk for them."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: The IDF releases situational update

children.content: Israel Defense Force spokesperson Jonathan Conricus said in the live stream there were Israeli Reserve soldiers around the Gaza Strip awaiting information for the next stage of the operation.
Mr Conricus has reaffirmed the IDF's objective was to target Hamas.

"The end state of this war is that we will dismantle Hamas and their military capabilities and fundamentally change the situation so that Hamas never again has the ability to inflict any damage on Israeli civilians or soldiers," he said.
He said in the broadcast that "Palestinian civilians in Gaza are not our enemies."
Â
"If they were, the situation in Gaza would be entirely different," he said.
"We are trying to do the right thing, we are trying to evacuate civilians in order to minimise the risk for them."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Israel's military says it has struck a Hezbollah target in southern Lebanon in response to the "infiltration of unidentified aerial objects into Israel" as well as an Israeli drone coming under fire in the area. The IDF earlier reported its aerial defences had intercepted two unidentified objects above the port city of Haifa, about 140 kilometres south of the border with Lebanon, as well as a single object above the nearby Arab-majority city of Shfaram.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: IDF strikes Hezbollah after 'unidentified objects' enter airspace

children.content: Israel's military says it has struck a Hezbollah target in southern Lebanon in response to the "infiltration of unidentified aerial objects into Israel" as well as an Israeli drone coming under fire in the area.

The IDF earlier reported its aerial defences had intercepted two unidentified objects above the port city of Haifa, about 140 kilometres south of the border with Lebanon, as well as a single object above the nearby Arab-majority city of Shfaram.
